content:
Installations Check if your PC is compatible.¬†Not all Windows 11 PCs can run Android apps. To check if your PC is compatible, open the Settings app and go to¬†System > About. Under ‚ÄúSpecifications,‚Äù look for ‚ÄúProcessor,‚Äù ‚ÄúRAM,‚Äù and ‚ÄúVirtualization.‚Äù Your PC must have a 64-bit processor, 4GB of RAM, and virtualization enabled in order to run Android apps.
Enable virtualization.¬†If virtualization is not enabled on your PC, you will need to enable it before you can run Android apps. To enable virtualization, open the Start menu and search for ‚ÄúTurn Windows features on or off.‚Äù In the Turn Windows features on or off window, scroll down and look for ‚ÄúVirtualization.‚Äù Check the box next to ‚ÄúVirtualization‚Äù and click OK. Your PC will restart.
Install the Amazon Appstore.¬†The Amazon Appstore is the only official way to install Android apps on Windows 11. To install the Amazon Appstore, open the Microsoft Store and search for ‚ÄúAmazon Appstore.‚Äù Click Install and follow the instructions.
Sign in to the Amazon Appstore.¬†Once the Amazon Appstore is installed, you will need to sign in with your Amazon account. If you don‚Äôt have an Amazon account, you can create one for free.
Search for and install Android apps.¬†Once you are signed in to the Amazon Appstore, you can search for and install Android apps just like you would on an Android device. To install an app, click the Install button.
Run Android apps.¬†Once an Android app is installed, you can run it from the Start menu or by clicking its icon on the desktop. Android apps will appear in the Start menu alongside your Windows apps.
Download WSA (Windows Subsystem for Android‚Ñ¢Ô∏è) logseq.order-list-type:: number Download WSATools APK Installer logseq.order-list-type:: number Searching & Downloading any android app in Windows (After Installingüéâüéâ) Obtain the app ID: logseq.order-list-type:: number Search your desired android app on playstore web version to get the id, We will use instagram as an example: logseq.order-list-type:: number The app ID is located in the url as a parameter! In this case: com.instagram.android logseq.order-list-type:: number Download the apk file (on you computer): logseq.order-list-type:: number Navigate to Apkpure.com/ and use the app id to search: logseq.order-list-type:: number Download the apk file version you want: logseq.order-list-type:: number Install apk in Windows using WSATools: logseq.order-list-type:: number Load the apk file to WSATools from you Downloads folder: logseq.order-list-type:: number (EXTRA) Enabling ADB ‚öíÔ∏è Common problems and fixes? Enable and Troubleshoot ADB https://github.com/Simizfo/WSATools/blob/main/Guides/EnableADBDebugging.md
summary:
Installations Check if your PC is compatible.¬†Not all Windows 11 PCs can run Android apps. To check if your PC is compatible, open the Settings app and go to¬†System > About. Under ‚ÄúSpecifications,‚Äù look for ‚ÄúProcessor,‚Äù ‚ÄúRAM,‚Äù and ‚ÄúVirtualization.‚Äù Your PC must have a 64-bit processor, 4GB of RAM, and virtualization enabled in order to run Android apps.
Enable virtualization.¬†If virtualization is not enabled on your PC, you will need to enable it before you can run Android apps.
title: How to install Android apps in Windows 11
